items.title: Eighty-eight postal operators stop sending mail to the US over tariffs
items.standfirst: Some 88 postal operators have either fully or partially stopped sending mail to the US due to President Donald Trump's cancellation of a tax exemption for small packages, the Universal Postal Union said Saturday. In the week since the new rule was introduced, postal traffic to the US fell 81 percent, the group said.
items.content: Some 88 postal operators have either fully or partially stopped sending mail to the US due to President Donald Trump's cancellation of a tax exemption for small packages, the Universal Postal Union said Saturday. In the week since the new rule was introduced, postal traffic to the US fell 81 percent, the group said.

items.content: Anthropic PBC will pay at least $1.5 billion plus interest to resolve an authors’ copyright lawsuit over the AI company’s downloading of millions of pirated books, one of the largest settlements over artificial intelligence and intellectual property to date.

items.title: UK's Starmer reshuffles top team to restore authority after Rayner blow
items.standfirst: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer brought in a new deputy and foreign and interior ministers on Friday in a sweeping reshuffle intended to restore his authority after the resignation of his deputy, Angela Rayner. Starmer could do little to protect Rayner after Britain's independent adviser ruled that she had breached the ministerial code by failing to pay the correct tax. Story by Camille Knight.
items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer brought in a new deputy and foreign and interior ministers on Friday in a sweeping reshuffle intended to restore his authority after the resignation of his deputy, Angela Rayner. items.title: Afghan earthquake death toll jumps to more than 2,200, say Taliban
items.standfirst: Aid agencies plead for funds as rough terrain hinders relief effort and 98% of buildings in one province are damagedThe death toll from a major earthquake in Afghanistan this week has jumped to more than 2,200, just as another magnitude 6.2 earthquake hit the southeastern region of the country on Thursday night.On Thursday, Taliban spokesperson Hamdullah Fitrat confirmed that the death toll from Sunday’s earthquake had risen to 2,205 – up from previous estimates of 1,400 – making it one of the deadliest natural disasters to hit the country in decades. Continue reading...
items.content: Aid agencies plead for funds as rough terrain hinders relief effort and 98% of buildings in one province are damagedThe death toll from a major earthquake in Afghanistan this week has jumped to more than 2,200, just as another magnitude 6.2 earthquake hit the southeastern region of the country on Thursday night.On Thursday, Taliban spokesperson Hamdullah Fitrat confirmed that the death toll from Sunday’s earthquake had risen to 2,205 – up from previous estimates of 1,400 – making it one of the deadliest natural disasters to hit the country in decades. Continue reading...

items.title: Third earthquake hits Afghanistan as death toll rises above 2,200
items.standfirst: South-east of country rocked as rescuers struggle to find survivors of first quakeA magnitude 6.2 earthquake has shaken Afghanistan as the death toll from the devastating quake on Sunday rose to more than 2,200.It struck south-eastern regions on Thursday night, according to the Helmholtz Centre for Geosciences in Germany. It was not immediately clear how much damage there was. Continue reading...
items.content: South-east of country rocked as rescuers struggle to find survivors of first quakeA magnitude 6.2 earthquake has shaken Afghanistan as the death toll from the devastating quake on Sunday rose to more than 2,200.It struck south-eastern regions on Thursday night, according to the Helmholtz Centre for Geosciences in Germany. It was not immediately clear how much damage there was. Continue reading...

Why it matters: Language that seemingly threatens to wage war on an American city is a significant escalation from Trump who has already deployed the…
items.content: President Trump on Saturday threatened to unleash "the Department of WAR" on Chicago in a Truth Social image evoking the film "Apocalypse Now." Why it matters: Language that seemingly threatens to wage war on an American city is a significant escalation from Trump who has already deployed the…

items.title: Trump threatens 'Apocalypse Now'-style action against Chicago to boost deportations
items.standfirst: President Trump threatened the city with the deportation of undocumented immigrants, posting a reference to the film Apocalypse Now with the quote: "I love the smell of deportations in the morning."
items.content: President Trump threatened the city with the deportation of undocumented immigrants, posting a reference to the film Apocalypse Now with the quote: "I love the smell of deportations in the morning."(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster)

ai_summary: Trump used Truth Social to threaten Chicago with "Department of WAR" imagery.
The image referenced the film "Apocalypse Now," evoking war themes.
This is a significant escalation from Trump's previous rhetoric.
The threat was related to deportations of undocumented immigrants.
Trump's post included the quote, "I love the smell of deportations in the morning."

clusters.title: US: ICE conducts large-scale immigration raid on Hyundai manufacturing site
clusters.neutral_headline: ICE Conducts Large-Scale Raid at Hyundai Site in Georgia

items.title: US: ICE conducts large-scale immigration raid on Hyundai manufacturing site
items.standfirst: Hundreds of federal agents descended on a sprawling site where Hyundai manufactures electric vehicles in Georgia and detained 475 people, most of them South Korean nationals. This is the latest in a long line of workplace raids conducted as part of the Trump administration's mass deportation agenda. But this one is especially distinct because of its large size and the fact that it targeted a manufacturing site state officials have long called Georgia's largest economic development project. Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor Douglas Herbert.
items.content: Hundreds of federal agents descended on a sprawling site where Hyundai manufactures electric vehicles in Georgia and detained 475 people, most of them South Korean nationals. This is the latest in a long line of workplace raids conducted as part of the Trump administration's mass deportation agenda. But this one is especially distinct because of its large size and the fact that it targeted a manufacturing site state officials have long called Georgia's largest economic development project. Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs editor Douglas Herbert.

items.title: 475 people detained in raid by ICE, other agencies at Hyundai site in Georgia
items.standfirst: The operation targeted one of Georgia's largest and most high-profile manufacturing sites, where Hyundai makes electric vehicles and is building an EV battery plant.
items.content: The operation targeted one of Georgia's largest and most high-profile manufacturing sites, where Hyundai makes electric vehicles and is building an EV battery plant.

ai_summary: ICE agents detained 475 people at a Hyundai manufacturing site in Georgia.
Most of those detained were South Korean nationals.
The raid targeted a large manufacturing site in Georgia.
This is part of the Trump administration's mass deportation agenda.
The site is considered Georgia's largest economic development project.

items.title: Verstappen grabs Monza pole with fastest F1 lap
items.standfirst: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes pole position for the Italian Grand Prix from McLaren's Lando Norris.
items.content: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes pole position for the Italian Grand Prix from McLaren's Lando Norris.

ai_summary: Max Verstappen achieved pole position at the Italian Grand Prix.
He set the fastest lap in Formula 1 history.
Verstappen's lap time was 1:18.792.
Lando Norris of McLaren took second place.
The race is taking place at Monza.

clusters.title: Biden chooses Delaware as site for presidential library
clusters.neutral_headline: Biden Chooses Delaware for Presidential Library

items.title: Biden chooses Delaware as site for presidential library
items.standfirst: The Joe and Jill Biden Foundation, this past week, approved a 13-person governance board that is charged with steering the project.
items.content: The Joe and Jill Biden Foundation, this past week, approved a 13-person governance board that is charged with steering the project.

items.title: Joe Biden to begin fundraising to build presidential library in Delaware
items.standfirst: Effort could be a tough task in current political climate, with Trump maligning ex-president and left-leaning groups dailyFormer US president Joe Biden has decided to build his presidential library in Delaware and has tapped a group of former aides, friends and political allies to begin the heavy lift of fundraising and finding a site for the museum and archive.The Joe and Jill Biden Foundation this past week approved a 13-person governance board that is charged with steering the project. The board includes former secretary of state Antony Blinken, longtime adviser Steve Ricchetti, prolific Democratic fundraiser Rufus Gifford and others with deep ties to the one-term president and his wife. Continue reading...
items.content: Effort could be a tough task in current political climate, with Trump maligning ex-president and left-leaning groups dailyFormer US president Joe Biden has decided to build his presidential library in Delaware and has tapped a group of former aides, friends and political allies to begin the heavy lift of fundraising and finding a site for the museum and archive.The Joe and Jill Biden Foundation this past week approved a 13-person governance board that is charged with steering the project. The board includes former secretary of state Antony Blinken, longtime adviser Steve Ricchetti, prolific Democratic fundraiser Rufus Gifford and others with deep ties to the one-term president and his wife. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Joe Biden will build his presidential library in Delaware.
A 13-person governance board was approved to oversee the project.
The board includes former Secretary of State Antony Blinken.
Fundraising efforts will begin in the current political climate.
The project may face challenges due to political opposition.

clusters.title: American Killed in Portugal Funicular Crash Identified
clusters.neutral_headline: American Killed in Portugal Funicular Crash Identified

items.title: American Killed in Portugal Funicular Crash Identified
items.standfirst: At least 16 people have been killed and 21 injured after a funicular railway in Lisbon derailed on Wednesday.
items.content: At least 16 people have been killed and 21 injured after a funicular railway in Lisbon derailed on Wednesday.

items.title: College of Charleston instructor among victims killed in Lisbon funicular crash
items.standfirst: The College of Charleston confirmed on Friday that one of its instructors was among the 16 people killed in the crash of the popular funicular railway in Lisbon on Wednesday.
items.content: The College of Charleston confirmed on Friday that one of its instructors was among the 16 people killed in the crash of the popular funicular railway in Lisbon on Wednesday.

ai_summary: A funicular railway in Lisbon derailed, resulting in fatalities.
Sixteen people were killed in the funicular crash.
Twenty-one people were injured in the accident.
One of the victims was a College of Charleston instructor.
The instructor's death was confirmed by the college.

clusters.title: Musk’s $1T pay package is full of watered-down versions of his own broken promises
clusters.neutral_headline: Musk’s $1T pay package is full of watered-down versions of his own broken promises

items.title: Musk’s $1T pay package is full of watered-down versions of his own broken promises
items.standfirst: Musk used to say Tesla would make 20 million cars and one million humanoid robots per year. The company's board wants far less than that in exchange for $1 trillion.
items.content: Musk used to say Tesla would make 20 million cars and one million humanoid robots per year. The company's board wants far less than that in exchange for $1 trillion.

items.title: Tesla Proposes a Trillion-Dollar Bet That It's More Than Just Cars
items.standfirst: Tesla’s board wants to give Elon Musk an unprecedented $1 trillion pay package. To get all the money, he has to make robots and robotaxis work.
items.content: Tesla’s board wants to give Elon Musk an unprecedented $1 trillion pay package. To get all the money, he has to make robots and robotaxis work.

ai_summary: Tesla's board wants to give Elon Musk a $1 trillion pay package.
Musk used to say Tesla would make 20 million cars annually.
He also said Tesla would make one million humanoid robots per year.
The board wants less than that in exchange for the money.
To get the money, he has to make robots and robotaxis work.

clusters.title: In pictures: Crowds and fashion royalty bid farewell to Giorgio Armani
clusters.neutral_headline: Crowds and fashion royalty bid farewell to Giorgio Armani

items.title: In pictures: Crowds and fashion royalty bid farewell to Giorgio Armani
items.standfirst: Crowds in Milan on Saturday waited in line to see the coffin of late fashion designer Giorgio Armani, who died this week aged 91 and is now lying in state for two days. Among the mourners were Italian fashion designer Donatella Versace, mayor of Milan Giuseppe Sala and Ferrari chairman John Elkann.
items.content: Crowds in Milan on Saturday waited in line to see the coffin of late fashion designer Giorgio Armani, who died this week aged 91 and is now lying in state for two days. Among the mourners were Italian fashion designer Donatella Versace, mayor of Milan Giuseppe Sala and Ferrari chairman John Elkann.

items.title: Donatella Versace among mourners as Giorgio Armani lies in state
items.standfirst: Donatella Versace has joined scores of mourners in Milan to pay respects to legendary fashion designer Giorgio Armani as his body lies in state.
items.content: Donatella Versace has joined scores of mourners in Milan to pay respects to legendary fashion designer Giorgio Armani as his body lies in state.

ai_summary: Giorgio Armani died this week at the age of 91.
His body is lying in state in Milan for two days.
Donatella Versace was among the mourners.
The mayor of Milan, Giuseppe Sala, attended the event.
Ferrari chairman John Elkann was also present.

clusters.title: Thailand’s political crisis: What you need to know
clusters.neutral_headline: Thailand's New Prime Minister Elected

items.title: Thailand’s political crisis: What you need to know
items.standfirst: 🇹🇭 What’s happening in Thailand? 🗳️Construction tycoon Anutin Charnvirakul was elected prime minister on Friday after breezing through a parliamentary vote. ✈️ But on Thursday, former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra suddenly left the country. The Supreme Court is set to decide on Tuesday, September 9, whether he must return to prison. FRANCE 24 brings you the details 👆
items.content: 🇹🇭 What’s happening in Thailand? 🗳️Construction tycoon Anutin Charnvirakul was elected prime minister on Friday after breezing through a parliamentary vote. ✈️ But on Thursday, former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra suddenly left the country. The Supreme Court is set to decide on Tuesday, September 9, whether he must return to prison. FRANCE 24 brings you the details 👆

items.title: Tycoon who led push to decriminalise cannabis becomes Thai PM
items.standfirst: Anutin Charnvirakul voted in by parliament after promising election in four months, as Thaksin Shinawatra jets outAnutin Charnvirakul, a staunch royalist, has been appointed by lawmakers as Thailand’s next prime minister after days of heated negotiations and political drama.The 58-year-old tycoon turned politician is considered a conservative, though he made a name for himself for leading a campaign to decriminalise cannabis. He was voted in after a chaotic scramble by parties to gain enough support to replace the ousted PM, Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who was removed from office by a court ruling. Continue reading...
items.content: Anutin Charnvirakul voted in by parliament after promising election in four months, as Thaksin Shinawatra jets outAnutin Charnvirakul, a staunch royalist, has been appointed by lawmakers as Thailand’s next prime minister after days of heated negotiations and political drama.The 58-year-old tycoon turned politician is considered a conservative, though he made a name for himself for leading a campaign to decriminalise cannabis. He was voted in after a chaotic scramble by parties to gain enough support to replace the ousted PM, Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who was removed from office by a court ruling. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Anutin Charnvirakul was elected as Thailand's prime minister.
He was elected after a parliamentary vote.
Former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra left the country.
The Supreme Court will decide on Shinawatra's prison return.
Charnvirakul led a campaign to decriminalize cannabis.

clusters.title: Trump rebrands the Department of Defense as the 'Department of War'
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump rebrands the Department of Defense as the 'Department of War

items.title: Trump rebrands the Department of Defense as the 'Department of War'
items.standfirst: After months of campaigning for the Nobel Peace Prize, President Donald Trump sent a sharply different message on Friday when he signed an executive order aimed at rebranding the Department of Defense as the Department of War. Story by Laurent Berstecher.
items.content: After months of campaigning for the Nobel Peace Prize, President Donald Trump sent a sharply different message on Friday when he signed an executive order aimed at rebranding the Department of Defense as the Department of War. Story by Laurent Berstecher.

items.title: Defense Department Scrambles to Pretend It’s Called the War Department
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said the so-called Department of War branding is to counter the “woke” Department of Defense name.
items.content: President Donald Trump said the so-called Department of War branding is to counter the “woke” Department of Defense name.

ai_summary: Donald Trump signed an executive order to rebrand the Department of Defense.
The new name is the Department of War.
The rebranding is to counter the "woke" name.
The change was made after months of campaigning for the Nobel Peace Prize.
The Department of Defense is now referred to as the Department of War.

clusters.title: Male-only succession rules overshadow Japan prince’s coming-of-age
clusters.neutral_headline: Male-only succession rules overshadow Japan prince’s coming-of-age

items.title: Male-only succession rules overshadow Japan prince’s coming-of-age
items.standfirst: Prince Hisahito is first male royal to reach adulthood in 40 years. He could also be last in world's oldest monarchy.
items.content: Prince Hisahito is first male royal to reach adulthood in 40 years. He could also be last in world's oldest monarchy.

items.title: Japan’s second in line to emperor’s throne comes of age amid succession debate
items.standfirst: Teenage Prince Hisahito’s elaborate ceremony overshadowed by questions over royal family’s male-only succession rulesJapan has heralded the coming of age of Prince Hisahito with an elaborate ceremony at the Imperial Palace, where a succession crisis is brewing.The nephew of Emperor Naruhito, Hisahito received a black silk and lacquer crown at Saturday’s ceremony in Tokyo, which marks the beginning of his royal adult life. Continue reading...
items.content: Teenage Prince Hisahito’s elaborate ceremony overshadowed by questions over royal family’s male-only succession rulesJapan has heralded the coming of age of Prince Hisahito with an elaborate ceremony at the Imperial Palace, where a succession crisis is brewing.The nephew of Emperor Naruhito, Hisahito received a black silk and lacquer crown at Saturday’s ceremony in Tokyo, which marks the beginning of his royal adult life. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Prince Hisahito reached adulthood in Japan.
He is the first male royal to reach adulthood in 40 years.
He could be the last in the world's oldest monarchy.
An elaborate ceremony was held at the Imperial Palace.
Questions surround the royal family's male-only succession rules.

clusters.title: Judge rules ending protections for Venezuelan and Haitian migrants is unlawful
clusters.neutral_headline: Judge rules ending protections for Venezuelan and Haitian migrants is unlawful

items.title: Judge rules ending protections for Venezuelan and Haitian migrants is unlawful
items.standfirst: The decision is in response to the Trump administration's efforts to end temporary protected status (TPS).
items.content: The decision is in response to the Trump administration's efforts to end temporary protected status (TPS).

items.title: Judge blocks ending of legal protections for 1m Venezuelans and Haitians in US
items.standfirst: Homeland security had tried to end temporary protected status granted by the Biden administrationA federal judge on Friday ruled against the Trump administration from ending temporary legal protections that have granted more than 1 million people from Haiti and Venezuela the right to live and work in the United States.The ruling by US district judge Edward Chen of San Francisco for the plaintiffs means that 600,000 Venezuelans whose temporary protections expired in April or whose protections were about to expire on 10 September have status to stay and work in the United States. Continue reading...
items.content: Homeland security had tried to end temporary protected status granted by the Biden administrationA federal judge on Friday ruled against the Trump administration from ending temporary legal protections that have granted more than 1 million people from Haiti and Venezuela the right to live and work in the United States.The ruling by US district judge Edward Chen of San Francisco for the plaintiffs means that 600,000 Venezuelans whose temporary protections expired in April or whose protections were about to expire on 10 September have status to stay and work in the United States. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A judge blocked the ending of legal protections for Venezuelans and Haitians.
The ruling is in response to the Trump administration's efforts.
The protections are known as Temporary Protected Status (TPS).
The ruling affects over 1 million people from Haiti and Venezuela.
600,000 Venezuelans can stay and work in the US.
